# isPrimaryConstituentDeviceSwitchingBehaviorForRecordingEnabled

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether to restrict constituent device switching behavior during recording.

## Declaration

```swift
var isPrimaryConstituentDeviceSwitchingBehaviorForRecordingEnabled: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

Use this property to enable camera switching restrictions when recording movies. You set restrictions by calling the output’s [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureMovieFileOutput/setPrimaryConstituentDeviceSwitchingBehaviorForRecording(_:restrictedSwitchingBehaviorConditions:)] method. The restrictions take effect when you start recording, and revert to the behavior set by the capture device’s [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/primaryConstituentDeviceSwitchingBehavior-swift.property] when you stop recording.

By default, this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] when connected to a capture device that supports constituent device switching.

## Restricting camera switching

- **setPrimaryConstituentDeviceSwitchingBehaviorForRecording(_:restrictedSwitchingBehaviorConditions:)**: Sets the camera switching behavior to use during recording.
- **primaryConstituentDeviceSwitchingBehaviorForRecording**: The camera switching behavior to use for recording.
- **primaryConstituentDeviceRestrictedSwitchingBehaviorConditionsForRecording**: The conditions during which camera switching may occur while recording.
